Package hac.controllers

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
hac.controllers.GameController
@Controller @RequestMapping("/game") public class GameController extends Object
The Controller handles the rests related to the game management.

  • Method Details

    • getWaitToStartPage

      @GetMapping("/wait-to-start-page") public String getWaitToStartPage()
      The page is a waiting page till all the players in the room submits their boards set.
      Returns:
      Html for the waiting room html.

    • onGamePage

      @GetMapping("/on-game") public String onGamePage(org.springframework.ui.Model model, Principal principal)
      This path return to the user the game in it's position.
      Parameters:
      model - - used to add parameters
      principal - - To extract username
      Returns:
      The game page's html.

    • gameInit

      @GetMapping("/init") public String gameInit(org.springframework.ui.Model model, Principal principal)
      This route sends the initGame html for user - the html that includes the register board status.
      Parameters:
      model - - used to add parameters
      principal - - To extract username
      Returns:
      initGame html.

    • postBoard

      @PostMapping("/init") public String postBoard(@RequestParam("boardName") String boardString, org.springframework.ui.Model model, Principal principal)
      This route is receiving the board, check it, and if it is a valid board, it also return the user to waiting for start page. The board should be looking like that: a json object as a string - {submarines: [{firstRow:___, firstCol:___, lastRow:___, lastCol:___, size:___}, {...},...]}
      Parameters:
      boardString - looking like that: {submarines: [{firstRow:___, firstCol:___, lastRow:___, lastCol:___, size:___}, {...},...]}
      model - - used to add parameters
      principal - - To extract username
      Returns:
      The init page when there is a problem with the received string or redirects to game/wait-to-start-page if the board sent successfully.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - When the board is invalid. The runtime exception could be in many types and are handler inside ExceptionHandlers.

    • getForDeniedAccess

      @GetMapping("/update") public String getForDeniedAccess()
      Redirect to /game/on-game when just /update sent to the server to handle with this situation. /update is a post route.
      Returns:
      "redirect:/game/on-game"

    • finishGame

      @GetMapping("/finish-page") public String finishGame(org.springframework.ui.Model model, Principal principal)
      Return the finish-page and display the results if the player found in the room. Otherwise, in failer, the user redirects to /lobby/error-message.
      Parameters:
      model - - used to add parameters
      principal - - To extract username
      Returns:
      The finish page when user found in db or redirects to

    • handleValidationExceptions

      @ResponseStatus(BAD_REQUEST) @ExceptionHandler(org.springframework.web.bind.MethodArgumentNotValidException.class) public String handleValidationExceptions(org.springframework.web.bind.MethodArgumentNotValidException ex, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Exception handler that handles with db errors
      Parameters:
      ex - - The exception.
      model - - used to add parameters
      Returns:
      gameInit page with the relevant errors.

    • handleValidationExceptions

      @ResponseStatus(BAD_REQUEST) @ExceptionHandler(jakarta.validation.ConstraintViolationException.class) public String handleValidationExceptions(jakarta.validation.ConstraintViolationException ex, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Handle with ConstraintViolationException exceptions.
      Parameters:
      ex - The exception
      model - To add attributes to html.
      Returns:
      gameInit page with the relevant errors.

    • handleAllExceptions

      @ExceptionHandler(InvalidChoiceError.class) public String handleAllExceptions(InvalidChoiceError e, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Exception handler to handle with invalid user's choice (like problems with board)
      Parameters:
      e - the exception.
      model - - used to add parameters
      Returns:
      gameInit page with the relevant errors.

    • handleAllExceptions

      @ExceptionHandler(GameOver.class) public String handleAllExceptions(GameOver e)
      Exception handler that handles with game over state. It redirects the user to finish-page.
      Parameters:
      e - The error message (This is not a real error)
      Returns:
      redirects the user to finish-page.

    • handleAllExceptions

      @ExceptionHandler(java.lang.Exception.class) public String handleAllExceptions(Exception e)
      Exception handler that handles with all the exceptions in pages. It redirects the user to lobby with an error message.
      Parameters:
      e - The exception
      Returns:
      "redirect:/lobby/error-message"
